intro: Gunnia australis, commonly known as the Australian gunnia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine, silvery-white layer of wax. Gunnia australis is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
